resource_dependency.poll_data_schema: Table 'polls' with fields: id (UUID), title (TEXT), description (TEXT), created_at (TIMESTAMP). Table 'options' with fields: id (UUID), poll_id (foreign key to polls.id), option_text (TEXT), vote_count (INTEGER DEFAULT 0).

function: Fetch all available polls from the backend API and render them on the frontend.
static_description: A white background page with navy-styled cards displaying each poll’s title and description. Cards are arranged vertically with consistent spacing.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a poll card navigates the user to the voting page for that specific poll.
Users can scroll through the list of polls if there are more than fit on screen.

resource_dependency.polls_table_schema: CREATE TABLE polls (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT NOT NULL, description TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()); CREATE TABLE options (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, poll_id UUID REFERENCES polls(id), option_text TEXT NOT NULL, vote_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0);

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database and define tables to store poll data, options, and vote counts.
static_description: No visible UI element; this is a backend setup configuration ensuring persistence of poll-related data.

resource_dependency.session_tracking_mechanism: Use cookies or localStorage to track user sessions and prevent duplicate votes.

function: Allow users to select an option and submit their vote via an API call.
static_description: White background with navy-styled radio buttons representing each voting option, a submit button below, and clear labeling of the current poll question.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a radio button highlights it. Clicking the submit button sends the selected option to the backend API.
After submitting, the system redirects to the results view for the same poll.

resource_dependency.chart_library: Chart.js or similar library for rendering bar graphs
resource_dependency.result_visualization_component: Bar chart showing vote distribution among options

function: Display real-time voting results immediately after a user casts their vote.
static_description: White background with navy-styled header indicating the poll name. Below, a bar graph visualizes the number of votes per option.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon loading the results page, fetch updated vote counts from the backend and render the chart accordingly.

resource_dependency.vote_storage_procedure: SQL procedure to increment vote count safely using atomic operations
resource_dependency.duplicate_vote_prevention_logic: Check session identifier before allowing a vote update

function: Ensure all votes are stored persistently in the database and retrieved accurately when needed.
static_description: No direct UI representation; ensures reliable backend operation for storing and retrieving votes.

function: Apply consistent styling throughout the application with a white background and navy components.
static_description: All pages feature a clean white background (#FFFFFF) with components styled in navy blue (#000080), including headers, buttons, and form elements.

resource_dependency.navigation_bar_component: <nav> element with links to Poll List, Current Vote View, and Results Page
resource_dependency.router_library: React Router or equivalent client-side routing mechanism

function: Enable seamless navigation between browsing polls, casting votes, and viewing results.
static_description: Fixed top navigation bar with navy links labeled 'Browse Polls', 'Vote', and 'Results'. Background remains white.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any link updates the displayed route without reloading the full page.

resource_dependency.error_modal_template: Modal dialog showing error messages such as 'Invalid selection' or 'Submission failed'

function: Handle errors gracefully when invalid selections occur or submissions fail.
static_description: Transparent overlay appears over content with centered navy-themed modal containing red-colored error message text.

interaction_and_states.description: Displays appropriate error message in modal upon receiving HTTP error responses from backend.
Clicking outside the modal or pressing ESC closes the error notification.

resource_dependency.loading_spinner_asset: Spinner animation asset file path or inline SVG
resource_dependency.loading_overlay_style: Full-screen semi-transparent overlay with centered spinner

interaction_and_states.description: Overlay becomes visible during API requests.
Overlay fades out once data arrives successfully.

function: Ensure the entire UI adapts fluidly across desktop and mobile device screens.
static_description: Layout adjusts automatically based on viewport size—stacked vertically on small screens, side-by-side where space allows.
